review: Great service tonight! Very friendly, attentive and efficient! Food was great. My chicken salad was a bit spicier than I had anticipated but still good.
I enjoy there house BBQ sauce it's amazing. Sometime friendly other times they get busy.. but they are great most of the time and I appreciate there hard work dealing with customers.. thank you...

I've been getting the fajitas for years but for the past year or so the quality of the food and the service have been going down. The chicken has no flavor. None! I swear the fajita pita from jack in the box tastes better. These fajitas used to be my favorite and I have continued to give then chance after chance but I'm done. I will not be going back for tasteless food.
Best Chili's I've ever been to. Food is always cooked as ordered...and if they think there's a problem with it...they'll replace it for free! Fast & friendly service & great wait staff.

We randomly stopped at this Chili's location for lunch when driving through the 15. At the peak lunch hour it was completely packed and we had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. We got a bunch of stuff from the menu starting with the Triple Dipper ($11.99) with two orders of the roll and one order of chicken wings, chicken and steak fajita ($13.99), chicken and salmon custom combo ($17.99), soup ($3.09), mango chicken ($10.59), Quesadilla salad with avocado ($11.99) and finally chocolate molten cake ($7.19). Taste-wise the rolls in the triple dipper were good whereas the wings seemed stale and tasteless. The chicken and steak fajita was delivered to the table sizzling, but it lacked any pazzazz. At least it was properly seasoned and edible. Surprisingly the best thing served to us was the salmon in the combination entree. It was cooked just right ensuring a moist and juicy bite but the chicken in the combo was dry from being overcooked. The chocolate molten cake was Blahh.  Service was a bit slow but it always feels that way when you are hungry. Pricewise also it was not too bad for a sit down meal. What would sum up this experience would be boring. Everything was passable. Nothing stood out nor was it bad enough to be sent back. I haven't been to many Chili's locations and after this visit I'm pretty sure that I've not missed much.

The service was good, waitress very polite. Unfortunately they charge $3.99 for chips and 3oz of salsa. Their steak knives are more like butter knifes. The corn on the cob is frozen corn. And why put video games on every table? A bit disappointed.

The hostess was missing in action...it was my sister my dad and i...we looked around as the team of servers looked stressed as if the place was packed....an optical illusion maybe? They stared right through us not one but all of them..didnt know what it was like to be transparent...i felt like i had a new super power....finally i had the courage to hunt one down and she went to go look for captain casper the friendly hostess.  Funny i didnt know ghosts were afraid of people. She looked scared and sat us down to our booth...5 minutes passed...5 more minutes passed...nobody greeted us...finally i told my sis...should we go to applebees? She said fine lets go...so we went...this was thursday 6-29-17 at 8:34 pm...

We love coming here all the time. We ordered takeout from there tonight. My salad and onion rings had something in them that made them too spicy to eat. I called and spoke to the manager Brian and he took complete care of the problem. He went above and beyond. I always order the same thing a-because I like it and b-because it isn't spicy. He gave me a couple suggestions as to what may have happened. So glad we will be able to eat here still!

Been here a few times, the last being on 10/7/17.  Won't be returning.  1st problem was the chips, hard as a rock since they weren't fried correctly.  2nd was my wife's fajita plate, the rice was also hard as a rock and cold. Last and final straw was the "Sunrise Burger", has a fried egg on top.  The egg was raw!  Unfortunately I had already ate the entire burger before I saw some of the egg that fell out of the burger and noticed the raw egg white.  I decided to tell the waitress since she asked how the meal was, with no complaint just an fyi for the restaurant.  What happened next is what changed my attitude.  The waitress has the nerve to talk to me like I'm a fool and says "it's a fried egg and has to be done lightly so it comes out raw for the egg yolk."  I've fried many eggs in my life and know that the egg white should never be raw and can still have a good yolk.  She then proceeded to snatch my plate from in front of me and storm off saying "I don't know what you want, you ate the entire thing.".  Again, it was not a complaint, I was well aware that I ate the entire burger but again I didn't notice how raw it was until I saw the piece of egg on the empty plate.  The waitress never returned to our table.  I had to finally ask to speak with the manager just so I could pay the check.  Shitty cook if you ask me so I don't know why the waitress was so rude.  Thanks for the pleasant lunch Bree.

Omg!! How many bad experiences can someone have at the same place!! Well, being the only sit down restaurant in the area, decided to give it another chance!!strike out again!! We waited 50 minutes for our food, our pasta came out cold. We complained, the manager Tom put it in the microwave and brought it out as though they remade it!!ugh, does he think we are stupid and wouldn't notice?! Kids chicken dippers were hard and dry like jerky!! My original chicken crispers came out as crispy!! They brought it back and it took another 20 minutes!! The last time we were here a very similar experience but the manager at that time seemed like he was drunk as well!! He was red, slurring his speech, and reeked of alcohol!! I've been a chilis fan since I was 9 years old, Never coming back here again!!

I have been going to this chili's since I was in elementary school and the service has progressively worsen.  We were say down with no wait time and very few customers were around. There were two servers and one host (short Hispanic women). Point is we waited for 15 minutes and no server came to ask us for drinks. We decided to just leave. We were sat at a secluded section and were likely forgotten or unknown to the servers. Honestly, if there is a shortage of servers the host should know better than to sit two people down. It's better to say there is a wait time of 10 to 15 minutes so we have a choice of staying here or not.

I came to Chillies for dinner, not expecting too much of the food, since it's a chain restaurant. I started out with chips and salsa. Both where smothered in salt. I asked for less salted chips and they came out the same. I tried asking for unsalted chips and what I got was a basket of chips so shiny from oil, they made MrClean's forehead look dull. Yuck.  For the main course I ordered the sirloin steak. The mashed potatoes on the side where cold and the steak was so dull and tasteless, I had airplane food that tasted better.  I will not willingly return to this Chitties.
Chili's has great food, fun atmosphere. Waiters and waitresses are very coutious and helpful.

Have you ever been eating your lukewarm food when you clearly hear your waitress exclaim, "I have to go potty." What a way to ruin an appetite. Food came out slowly, I had to constantly ask for additions which I had originally requested, Unprofessional, rude, lack of any type of personality, Also Jayde after her very long "potty" break forgot to bring me the final item of my order, which I just left because I had no time to eat it. Jayde needs to dramatically step up her customer service skills, but I don't have much hope for her because he manager is an imbecile as well, He did nothing the remedy the situation, not even a simple sorry about the service.  Go the the Chili's in Rancho Cucamonga, they are awesome, this Chili's needs a lot of training and maybe some common sense courses.

Very disappointed, they need more staff our waitress was so busy with all the tables she had. It took almost an hour to get our food. To make things worse  my order was wrong. Won't be coming here again.
Margherita flatbread chips and salsa and guacamole...can't beat it... plus great service

Came in on Martin Luther King's holiday. Waited for about 20 minutes. Okay no problem there. The problem came when we were seated. We waited an additional 10 minutes and had been passed up a few times. A table of four were seated after us, and a server came to them immediately. I'm not one to call for a manager, but I had to in this case. The manager, Namsah (hope I spelled her name correctly ) addressed the issue with great service, and an even greater apology. She gave us tableside homemade guacamole on the house, and she even prepared it!!  She had Melissa, our server, come and take care of us afterwards. She was very attentive, kind, and also apologetic. We've been to this Chili's plenty times before, but this is probably the one time that their service was below their normal Stellar standards.  Thanks for restoring my reasoning for wanting to eat here.

Grilled tacos to go Black Beans Mac & Cheese and salad side of Chile Lime Rice, way over rate.  You get very little fish on the tacos and just a little sliver of what they call avocado. The rice taste more of like sage rice than Chile Lime.The Mac & Cheese sauce should be a little more dense. Cheesy fries while go flavor if you get it to go it sticks real bad to the foil, better of if it was in a cup Not one of favorite places to go.

My server is super nice super attentive I think his name is ryan kinda looks like Justin Timberlake. Everything was great only giving 4 stars because some items were not available. Other than that great service.

Horrible customer service ...!! long wait before meal hits table overcharging customers and a horrible manager named Nomsa who lacks the ability to handle customer complaints. Won't ever be returning.

The food was really good and our waitress was very attentive and nice. The only reason they get only 4 stars is because of the hostess.  She and what could have been the shift manager....I'm thinking this because she had a set of keys on here arm... were busy chatting it up in the bar area and ignoring the people waiting to be seated.  The then just headed in the back.  After a couple more minutes of waiting I had to go get them to seat us and the people in front of us. Lucky for Chillies the waitress was so good.

I think Chili's has finally run it's course for us.  We received gift cards from the corporate office after a horrible experience at the location in Redlands, and decided to give the Fontana location a shot tonight. We checked in online and only had to wait about 10 minutes once we arrived.  We were seated at the crappiest table in the entire restaurant. Right next to the kitchen and the bathrooms. Literally my view was of a wall. When the host sat us, there wasn't even enough chairs for my entire family. So he had to go round them up. You'd think that this would be done prior to us being seated. We ordered the chips and guacamole to start. Most of the chips were soggy and oily. Not even remotely crispy. We were hungry, so we ate them anyway. My husband and I split the fajita trio which was mostly vegetables for $17.99. The steak was poor quality and very fatty. The chicken had zero flavor and there were only 5 tiny shrimp. Beans were cold and some of the shredded cheese had mold. My son ordered the club sandwich that was literally falling apart when brought to the table. The top of the sandwich bread had slid off and nobody bothered to think "Hey, this looks like somebody's leftovers, we should remake it properly." Nope. Just served it to us anyway. The lettuce was wilted and fries were cold.  Service was okay. Nothing spectacular, but the food and ambience were so shitty it really wouldn't have mattered. $67 for food that was one step above cafeteria slop. I would have had a better meal at In-N-Out for $15. I guess I value my money more than most, but I am really tired of restaurants serving shit food for nearly $100. Completely ridiculous. Sorry Chili's. You used to be a regular place for us, but you're no longer a good value for my family. Completely disgusting food topped off with cooks and servers that just don't care.

TLDR: food took too long. Enjoyed a cheap beer before leaving Went in for a nice meal before my night shift at my job. I had a little under hour to spare so I figured even with a longer wait I wouldn't have much of an issue. Had my drink and food ordered within the first 5-10 minutes of arriving and then....... Nothing. About 30 minutes passed without any indication of the food running late, the restaurant was sitting people as they came in when I first arrived so it didn't appear there would've been any significant reason for the delay. But given that there was very little time for me to actually enjoy the meal without having to rush so I found the host, explained the situation, paid for my beer and left.

Not happy they quoted me 30 to 40 minuets and when I ask how long at 40 minuets and they tell me 20 to 30...If hosts can't handle the load a manager should be coordinating...Every six months or so I forget how bad it is and make the mistake of coming here
Stopped in for drinks and wings.. no ultra on tap but bottles were ok.. wings were ok and service also. Was Sunday so football was on.

Service is okay, unfortunately this location is not very good for large groups. This Chili's seems a little smaller than the rest, there's only a few tables that they are able to use four groups of 6 or larger so the waiting will typically be more than usual. Food was as good as expected and our waiter was polite and prompt with what we needed. I recommend this place if you intend on going with less than 4 people and plan on hitting the bar. You'll get service much faster that way!

i walked into chilis with my husband and 2 children around 9pm today . the restaurant was very empty only the bar was occupied . several servers walked past us and none of them spoke to us or tried to help seat us . we stood in the front of the restaurant for about 20 minutes with a baby and a 4 year old and all the employees could care less . so we left . i will never be back and i would never give my hard earned money to a crap establishment like this location .

Trust me go to the grocery store buy the food you think you wanted to eat, go home you tube how to make it and you will be 1/2 the time before your even seated here. We waited an hour for a place that has had 7- 10 tables empty but let's make people wait not enough seats in the waiting area vs at least seating them. I highly recommend go son place else.

We're here at least once a month and our service is always great (servers are friendly, well-staffed and attentive). The food is great. The steak is mouth-watering and the Cajun chicken pasta is creamy and good. My kids love coming here and the Zoosk device entertains them so my hubby and I can enjoy talking to each other. If you're concerned about the wait to get in, use this app to get on the waitlist. I've used it twice now and are able to walk in and be seated immediately.

Seriously, JUST OK! Sadly, we've visited this spot several times, and it is nearly always a complete HIT or an absolute MISS! For a while there, I dreaded coming here because of a clueless hostess who had the entire restaurant in a state of utter confusion. Someway or another, we'd always end up "forgotten" when this hostess was the one seating us. Fortunately, she is no longer working here, but the service is, sadly, not as consistent as it should be.  The food has never been an issue (hence the OKness). I really enjoy their chips and guacamole, and they have several entrees that I am a fan of. I like the tex-mex pairing menu, as well as the fajitas. Can't go wrong with those. They also used to have this amazingly delicious watermelon lemonade, but I'm not sure where that went.  The place itself can be really dirty at times. Tables not clean for a while, etc. You never really know what you're going to get on any given day.  My best advice, cross your fingers before you walk in and hope it's a good visit!  On that note, I'll probably be back, eventually, when the bad experiences aren't so clear in my memory and I am sick of Applebees. The end.

It was so strange. Waited a long time to be seated and once we were, we waited quite a while to get our orders in. At first we were helped by a "busser?" who was very sweet, but not fully knowledgeable on the menu. Then we did see our server a couple times, but it seemed as if she might have been covering most of the tables in the restaurant so we didn't get a whole lot of attention. The food was good, but the drinks were hit and miss.

We went for dinner. My mom can't stand to long and all the waiting area was full so we sat her at a table next to the waiting area,and there were empty tables..after 20 min the hostess told her she couldn't sit there they needed the table..after having her stand for 15 more minutes they finally sat us......at that vary table they told us they needed..we asked for manager to complain but never came to our table....terrible service..

Sad to say this restaurant is going downhill. They have eliminated their serving staff with "bar and food runners" that are improperly trained ran our food and dessert to the wrong table Drinks took forever I won't be surprised if they are shut down soon. Very sad for s restaurant we have Been eating at for years
8/5/2017 5:00. pm...We sat in the bar area, our server was very busy but did an awesome job. Food was great, priced ok, service was fantastic.

We ordered chili's to go we drove up and didn't wait long,  but the parking lot is a hassle, there was no where to park for curbside pick up because the 2 spots that are for that, 1 had a customer waiting, the other had a motorcycle parked in it,  I think they should keep an eye on them making sure no one parks there since the parking lot is so small,  But food was good as it always is !  and the girl that brought it out was nice

I don't know why I even bother. Every time I order food to go, they get the order wrong. And it really takes multiple offenses to warrant a bad review from me. I really don't ask for much. All I ask is that the person preparing my food read my online order and make my dishes one at a time. So that the plain burger with only lettuce, doesn't end up with all the sauces on it. While the burger with all the extra fixings actually gets prepared correctly with the french fries on the side. I'm glad the girl at the check out counter caught they had forgotten to pack french fries. And speaking of sides... I paid an extra $1 for onion rings. Now check out the container of onion rings my dollar bought me with the pic I'm adding. I don't expect an grandiose amount, but I'd like to think my $1 would get me a little more than someone's leftovers. :-/

Love the service!!! All the servers are very helpful and quick. The chips and dip you can't go wrong. Thin with an amazing crisp, not oily. The chips yum! Triple play is a great appetizer but perfect for a meal as well. Fulfilling and great option choices. Would NOT recommend the newest addition to the menu- waffles and chicken. The sauce and dip are strange in flavor. Way too sweet and a spice that did not compliment well. Wasn't even able to finish the meal. Overall, It's a great fix for a bite to eat.
We eat here frequently. Great "2for" deals. Well prepared food with generous portions. Service is great. Would definitely recommend!

There was a a little wait (15 minutes) to get a clean table, but after we were seated service was prompt and courteous. Amanda suggested the 3 for $10, which had great choices and was a great deal for salad, dinner, and dessert! This was a nicer Chili's, easy to access, with great service and food!

I ordered car side to go tonight and received one of the worst meals I have had in a long time. I ordered the boneless buffalo chicken salad, the salad looked like it was thrown together with random vegetables that do not go together, I also ordered a side of chips and salsa and the chips were very greasy. I know they are fried, but they were full of oil, I've had there chips plenty of times, but they have never been that oily! It's pretty sad when people do not take pride in what they are serving, specially servers who expect to earn tips, check your expo line and look at your food before you send it out! You would of seen the chips were probably the end of the night batch that sat there for the past 2 hours! The cooks should take pride in what they are preparing, my salad was a soggy mess! Very disappointed, won't be back to this location!

Decided to stop in and get a quick bite to eat on a cold Monday evening, and chose Chili's as our destination. Place wasn't very busy, ( good thing ) and was seated in the back of Restaurant near kitchen entrance/exit. While waiting to be served I witnessed a server preparing a bowl of soup for a patron and adding condiments ( shredded cheese ) with his hands. After watching him do this a couple of times and then serve my soup the same way, I asked for a Manager. Was told by the Manager in charge Monday 12/05/16 that California laws had changed and that Restaurants were not required to wear gloves!! Shocking to me and I don't know anyone who would knowingly accept the practice of touching your food with bare hands if given the Choice. Food for thought.....just because they say you don't have to doesn't mean you shouldn't!!
Always good food and great service. We come here often because of the great deals I get through email. I have never had a bad experience!

Came here Sunday with my kids.  Service was pretty good, we came right in and was seated right away.  Our waiter came right over and got out drinks started.  We put in our order and we're eating within 10-15min.  I had the cheeseburger sliders which were absolutely delicious!  Our waitress was Haydee G, she was really nice and made sure we were taken care of.  We order a queso dip for an appetizer (which also was really good) Haydee offered to mix it for us, which was really nice of her!  Overall my kids and I had a nice time.  By the way we came all the way from Bellflower, and seen this location off the fwy.  Great location... If I'm ever in the area again I would definitely go back again.

Bad service, slow.  This place makes the DMV look like a McDonald's drive thru.  I do not know who is the manager nor the kitchen cook but some major issues here.  If you read the Yelp reviews, the biggest and most consistent complaint is about bad service/slow food.  Unfortunately, I agree.   Chil's food is Chili's food, you know what you are getting.   However, the service is very poor and needs some serious changes.   My advice:  Go elsewhere unless you feel like waiting 2 hours for mediocre food.

Service was terrible,  took my disabled mom there in December 2016 we waited for over 20 minutes and didn't get a drink, when I complained the manager was very nice and apologized but the waitresses there are always rushed and irritated up until it's time to tip them, and let me tell you it's not the first time here with terrible customer service,  get it together !

One of the worst experiences I've ever had. The service sucked my food came out cold. People that sat down 15 minutes after us got their food first. The manager clearly had no experience on handling a situation like this this'll probably be the last time I go to Chili's

Anne was our server today. She remembered what we always drink and brought them straight to the table. She is super nice and does a great job. Service with a smile always keeps us coming back to this Chili's.  Today, We had the panko crusted onion rings to start, shared the chicken bacon quesadilla, and finished off with the peach crumble cake. All were delicious!

Went in on a Fri evening around 7pm. The wait time wasn't too bad with the yelp check in. Once we were seated, we were able to place our orders in a timely manner. However, the wait time for the food was ridiculously long. The restaurant was not packed, there were empty tables surrounding us and half the diners that were there before us had left. The amount of time we waited for our food seemed like it was a full house. Once our food came, everything was hot and delicious except for  My daughter's food. She got the kid's mac and cheese. She only took one bite of it and just threw it to the side. Overall, food and service was great. The wait time for the food, not so great.

Came in for dinner and to watch the game tonight. While my main server was very polite and welcoming, there was another one whom was rushing me the entire time. I understand needing the table, but she brought me a box shortly after I had taken the first bite. Then persistently kept asking if I was done.

The salmon was a little on the salty side but everything else was really good. We ordered the spinach dip which is our favorite and the loaded fries were also good. They usually have 2 for 20 or 30$ meals which are always a great price for good quality food. I recommend it :)

I can say hands down worst customer service experience i have ever had was with manager Nomsa. She is rude disrespectful and unreasonable. This looks to be the norm for chilis. I am done going with this franchise overcharging with deceptive menu says 1 buck for steak on fajitas yet charges double. Refused adjustment on $200 total table bill. Long wait and most food came out cold. I use to be a regular here not no more. Suggest Bostons 15fwy and sierra

The drinks here are crap! I ordered something off the tap, my wife ordered a fruit Margarita and someone else ordered a different fruit Margarita. 15 minutes later they brought 2 regular Margaritas, and 5 minutes after that they brought my beer that looked like it was sitting there for 30min. It was a horrible beer. I don't know why bartenders think we don't know what our beers should taste like!?! It was flat and definitely didn't look like it came from the tap. Half of our time there was spent waiting on our drinks and bill. Two stars cause I've been here before and it wasn't that bad and I wasn't charged for my flat beer.

This is actually one of my favorite locations.  We come here all the time.  Seriously it's kind of weird how much we come here.  The service is hit or miss but for us it's usually more of a hit than other locations.  The staff comes and goes like crazy so you won't really get to have a favorite waiter or anything because they will leave after a few weeks.  We swill continue to come here as the food is usually very good.
Haven't been to Chili's in awhile. Food was not to good the services she was awesome but the food was not good.
I think I got food poisoning here. Service was pretty standard. Food was decent. Price a little high for two.
This is a good spot to go especially when having drinks with coworkers service is very well and have no complaints. I am a regular right here and not once have had bad service.

I am a local guest at this chilis and while I understand a busy night 40 minute ticket times and my whole family dining at different times. No follow up until last minute they comped one meal and an appetizer. Yes a nice gesture as a last stitch effort, but not enough to compensate 2 hours to get our entire meal as a family.. more concern should be there at least from the server..lacks service care
Service,  parking,  cleanliness,  food. ...all average.  I really wish it was better.  Food always arrives cold. ..ridiculous.

Food and drinks were fabulous, my server was awesome. I came with my two little ones who sat and ate with no problem. I will however say that if you're looking for adult time. I'd suggest you sit at the bar. The table next to me couldn't seem to control their kids, so every few seconds I would have to look over and make sure they didn't bump into our table. I love this Chilis, however, I did not love watching children run around my table.

From 1 to 5 stars......well, a negative 3 would be the best I would give! Absolutely aweful service, apathetic management and over 45 minutes until the food came...1 plate at time. If not for my mother and wife, I would have left 20 min into it. No excuse or reason, nor explanation for anything. I know I know, "maybe it was busy". Nope. Our party was 8 people. More than 4 other parties of at least four were seated AFTER us, served promptly and left BEFORE any of our food came. Oh, I forgot, that was also the case with the party of TWELVE ate and gone in less than 45 min. Again, arriving AFTER us. NEVER AGAIN WILL WE BE PATRONS AT THIS LOCATION. This is just my rant because I know that they couldn't give a rats butt if the lose patrons. But at least there's no waiting for drinks in the bar. Sincerely,  Disappointed and PISSED!

After ' my orginal review which included  a few different reviews of not so great food and/or service . I was contacted ed by the district manager who apologized for the bad experiences and offered $ 50.00 in chilli bucks to come back and try again ..well ' it took us 5 months to make the call and head back into the same location, some things have changed and some have stayed the same .. Guest services I feel need to be better ' I work hard for my $$ and if your taking it'. a hello ' how are you and general conversation would be great ..dont sit me down and come back in 20 mins ...Im your guest .smile ,offer me a drink ..a snack .I understand your busy ..But to me ' im your focus ..ok " you got it right the service still needs improvement .. The food was much better than previous times and did have some flavor and eye appeal.  I ordered the full ribs with the frys ..two type of sauce ..was good . For appetizer we had the fried asparagus.  I believe ' progress has been made in the food arena '  It makes me think of going back ' as before I would give my $$ to the other establishments offering greater faire .

We went to have a quick dinner around 7pm on August 1st. Our server was Priscilla C (as stated on our receipt, I don't recall if that was her name for sure. Shame on me). We sat in the bar area and had an amazing experience. She was happy, helpful, attentive, and went above and beyond. We got the chips and salsa as an appetizer and after finishing our meals decided to take the rest of the chips and salsa home. When we asked for a bag and small holder for the salsa she came back with a fresh new bag of chips and brand new salsa. She also offered to give us a refill of our drinks (only water, but still) to-go which was an amazingly pleasant surprise. She was a breath of fresh air in what seems to be an ever-deteriorating idea of what is "service." Thank you for such a nice experience!

This Chili's was an average experience. I took my Fiance here on our weekly date for the first time. We ordered the 2 for $35 deal which was awesome! We started off with Chips and Salsa as our appetizer, very delicious. My Fiance got the Margarita Chicken with two sides of french fires. When her plate got there the chicken was a little cold, but it had a good taste. I ordered the 6 oz sirloin medium well with asparagus. It was sizzling hot when it arrived and it tasted delicious. The deal comes with two presidential margaritas, but I upgraded both to the platinum for $4 more. I drank both of them and got a light buzz. The drinks could have used a little more tequila, but that is just my opinion. The service was a little slow, but he did bring everything I asked for. I would consider coming back, but not before I try the one out in Rancho Cucamonga first. P.S. When we were there a group of 3 guys stormed out ditching thier bill. Super ghetto lol

WILL NEVER GO TO THIS CHILI'S EVER AGAIN. Horrible service.  We had two servers helping me and my fiancé. The servers asked us if we are ready to order before we even peaked at the menu. We felt rushed to order. When we finally ordered an appetizer and two entrees, our entrees came first and the appetizer arrived when we were just about finished with our meal. The servers never asked us if we needed refills after passing by our table multiple times. The manager became involved with the late appetizer and comp it for us, and the manager offered us refills. The refills NEVER came. I hope this place goes out of business and they make it into more parking for the Stater Bro's and 5Guys.
10 minute wait to be greeted and slow service. I quickly remember why I stopped coming to this location.

MSG, MSG, MSG...I ate here a couple of months ago and got really sick with the symptoms of MSG poisoning but I blamed it on something else. Went back last night and got sick again with the Same exact symptoms. After not being able to sleep well and tossing and turning all night I realized it may be because they overload there food with MSG which they claim they do not or some combination of ingredients that they use that caused me to have such a negative reaction to their food. Sorry Chilis you will not be getting any more of my business until I figure out what you are doing that made me get sick.  BTW very slow service for a un-crowded restaurant at 10 pm at night. Took better than an hour from the time we got there until we left. About half of that was waiting to order, waiting for them to bring food, and waiting for a check.

It's was a group of 20 of us went called after TGIF denied us chillis they said yes 20 min and welcomed us with no problem we had no problem at all noone had no complaints place was great staff was great

I always wanted to try Chili's and it was a mistake. I ordered the chili and salad combo and my husband ordered th tripple dipple or something like that oh and fresh guacamole for app. The chips were cold, hard and oily. Terrible. The house salad was okay...you can never go wrong with a plain salad. The rest of the food took about 20 mins to come out. I was really looking forward to eat the chili but it was terrible. I should of gone to wendy's.....there chili is way better. I told our waiter about our food and said I would pay for what I ate which was the salad and the tripple meal because the rest was just bad. He brought the check out right away which I didnt ask for yet because my husband was still eating and he never checked on us after that. I still left him 15% tip tho.

The wait time was long  but was well it. The service was great . Thank you Samantha. Food was hot. That's a great thing! Most places give you a warm plate but warm food. I was surprised that the food great also. I got the Serloin steak . We had the free appetizer. I had a coupon on my phone. Chips were fresh and warm.  Steak was the exactly done and tender.

Should've read the reviews before coming. I was generous and gave 2 stars because a couple servers were nice, but really. You shouldn't ever compromise service because it's a busy night. We waited a long time (1 hour) and about 30 min for our food which wasn't that great! I had a steak. It was awful. Full of fat and very poor cut. That's what I get for going to a restaurant that doesn't specialize in steak. In addition to that, my other party members had a greasy steak and one had to sub out ribs for another meat because they ran out of ribs and it was only 6pm. Oh! I also had a drink spilled on me too!

Horrible service. The front host was walking so slow and didn't have a care in the world that the line was out the the door. With open tables throughout the restaurant you would expect to have people of small parties seated first and she didn't even do that. A man with his daughter was waiting for over 20 minutes and she didn't even seat them. I didn't appreciate the rudeness from an establishment I was visited before and loved.

I'm giving 3 stars only because, after all its Chili's.  But to be honest if this was my first visit to Chilis they would have gotten one star. Upon entry the hostess said she couldn't seat me unless I provided my phone number. I must add she wasn't nice about it either. We were finally seated and it took a while for the waitress to bring our drinks but that's understandable since its Veterans Day. The Veterans Day menu offered hamburger with fries and chicken crisps with fries and two other options. I figured I would be safe with the burger. When the burger came it was so salty I couldn't eat it. I was going to try to eat it but my son saw that I was struggling so he called the manager over. The manager told me that the burgers are made extra salty. He asked if I wanted another Burger without salt, I responded asking if I could have light seasoning and he said no however he did offer to make one without salt and allow me to Salt it myself. Because of the time it took to get her food which was over an hour I opted to try to continue with my burger. After two more bites I couldn't finish it so I just ate my fries. I likely won't return to this particular chilis and will make the long drive to West Covina where the service is great.
This place seriously blows. The service and the food. Can't say anything else you want to here.
So far, no bueno. Slow, understaffed, and dirty. I hope the food is better than the service. Well, it's Friday and Happy Hour!! #Cheers

Beside the wait for seating on the weekend night everything I will say was great friendly hostess Amanda  and her partner Joe were very helpful friendly and great service the food is good specially the Grilled con Fajitas.

Worse and worse every time we come and now we will never come back. Asked for a med rare steak got well done. Again . Our waitress never put In our app order. Hard to figure out how a corporate place could go so down hill . 3  strikes in a row chillis you are out
Substandard service, delay of fodder delivery and and SLOW bartender.   Now I remember why I don't like this location and would rather travel to a different one.
Had their new margarita pizza chicken salad.  Excellent light meal.  Would order it again.

Make sure to check you portions before you leave with your to-go order. My whole family ordered to go and my portion was much smaller than two other family members that ordered chicken. My portion looked like the rib meat that is attached to the chicken breast. In the future I will make sure to double check all orders before leaving.

I'm really bummed with the service I received here. I came here for my birthday and our waitress took our order but never came back to check on us or offer refills after we received our drinks and food. We even had to stop a busboy and order more drinks and napkins from him which he provided to us promptly. Bravo to the busboy! I'm not coming back here. I would rather drive to another Chilis where I know I'll receive better service.

This is based on a visit a couple of weeks ago on a Friday. Went into the bar for happy hour. Dirty tables everywhere. The waitress was chatting it up with another customer up at the bar. She made eye contact but just continued to chat. Left and went to the Chilis in Rancho. So much better.
Average food and ok service. 2.5    It's Chilis and they are a solid "c". They do have a decent bartender so we actually enjoy it more as a pub than an eatery.
Good place to go with a group. They have updated the restaurant but the food is very basic .
Service is really bad, if you can just sit in the bar are because if you get sat at a table you will be ignored. Food is decent

I eat here alot and i order to go mostly. This chilis has terrible parking and they have 2 spots reserved for to go customers but customers dining in often choose to fill these spots and chilis does nothing about this they dont get them towed or enforce company policy at all so if you order to go here plan on walking far because theres other inconsiderate assholes eating there that feel they need the spot more then you do

Horrible service We sat at the table for 20 minutes nobody even acknowledged us, they didn't even tell us we will be with you,or even offered us any water. At the time we were there it was not that busy. Left very disappointed taking our business elsewhere.

I came here for lunch on a Sunday. Order baby back ribs (half), fajitas (the mixed), and kid's cheese pizza. Baby back ribs were VERY VERY dry and over cooked. Barely had any meat on the ribs. It was mostly bone. The fajitas weren't too bad. Had few steak, chicken, and shrimp chunks but I wouldn't call it good either. There's not enough meat for the onions though. The cheese pizza, the dough was so thick! It was just like a thick dough with some pizza sauce and cheese on it. I'm not sure if that can even be consider a good pizza. Don't know how you can mess up on pizza anyway. Their free salsa and chips were the best.  House salsa was really good If service was good, maybe it would've made up for the bad food and I would've given another star.. First, the food took forever to come out. I believe it took 30 minutes and they weren't even busy. The place was pretty empty... She didn't even offer us chips and salsa at first (we had to ask for it) Barely saw our waitress around.

I come here all the time because I love the food ! Good customer service but I usually ask for Janet or Al because they are always nice, fast, and attentive. My family and I are always greeted when walking in and it is always very clean.

I have mostly taken food to go.  The time that it takes to food to go is usually accurate from the server.  The price of a chicken and steak fajita is about 13.95 with rice and beans is an extra 99 cents.  The food was sorted for easier transportation. However, the quantities for rice and beans was small due to the small packaging containers.  The half rack of ribs was about $14.95. The quantity was small. It didn't fulfill the appetite of my roommate.  The price out the door was about $30 out the door.  The taste was delicious.  The quantity was limited, but not enough for the price.

I will never set foot in this place again. Sat down at a table in the bar area and 5 min later some blonde walked out saying "hi! I'll be over in a min" as she was still walking away. Never asked if she could start drinks or anything. 10 min later she brought a lemonade to the table that was ordered through the manager. We waited as she kindly greeted tables and ran food. I tried giving her the benefit of the doubt since she was being sat all at once. Then more time went by and she greeted the table that had just sat and asked what they were drinking and eating. I kindly got up and walked my family and I out of there. I'll spend my money where it's appreciated.

This Chili's never disappoints for being a busy location for the 15 freeway travelers. The servers buckle down and take care of business! The menu always has something new and delicious and the Ziosk make ordering another drink easy peasy!

I live pretty close to this Chilis. Went New Years day, was a little crowded, girl at front desk said it would be 20 minutes. It ended up being 55 minutes before we got seated. I noticed that one of the hosts (male) kept letting friends have tables in front of all of us waiting, not cool !!. We ordered and did not get our food for another hour,,, that is just not right, the waitress apologized as best she could, and then the manager came to the tablet to ask if everything was ok ? We told him about the wait and he said, well now you cant complain cause you now have your food and walked away. Probably wont go back to this Chilis.
AL was our server and he was friendly and fast. We stopped coming for awhile but the new item on the menu are great! Fajitas are yummy The hostess Hannah made us feel welcome. We will be coming back!

Met a good friend of mine for a small bite and a drink. Came for the happy hour so sat in the bar. She got there early and luckily snagged us a table. It was pretty full. The waitress was on point. She checked on us frequently and was quick with the drinks. I have not been to Chili's in a while and was having fun with the interactive touch screen. But I was like a kid and had to have her pay the bills. Was neat and very futuristic.  LoL. Neat not having to hand off your card and wait. Best of all you can easily split the bill on your own too. Will have to come back.

Horrible...,,,, We sat down at a booth and each ordered a glass of wine and the waitress brought one dirty glass of wine and stated people steal their glasses and they were down to one.  Mike the manager laughed and said he had ordered more. We left. So disgusting

I enjoy the vibe here at this Chilis.  For some reason the chips and salsa are so addicting, yet they're so basic.  I'd like to be a regular here but I'm too busy!  It's always a good time here and a fun way to start off the night.

This place has a major hygiene issue.  They don't keep the tables and dishes clean from grease.  If they don't keep the dining area clean, imagine how dirty it may be in the kitchen.  Foods were consistently "not bad" just like any other Chili's restaurants.

Food was great the chips were fresh and light wit fresh sauce, spinachand artichoke dip was so good as well as the south west egg rolls and buffalo wings. Got the smok house bacon buger but took it home and gave it away because I had gotten full from the chips and dip . Are server was great so we he got pretty big tip and being holiday season, why not?

Love the amazing chips and salsa from chilies. Growing up in Fontana, CA Chilies was my parents favorite restaurant to eat at. Now that I have grown up it has become my favorite place to drink at lol. Football and wings on Sunday is how we like to enjoy our local chilies in summit.

Had lunch with my girly friend yesterday.  This location is in her hood, so it's newer than the one in my hood (where I was on Sunday).  Apparently, this chain has had a makeover, and a menu change, and taken on a team approach.  The makeover is tasteful even though I keep wanting to wipe off the chili logo/shadow that's on every table.  Menu has some good deals/prices, especially for lunch and some new healthy option type choices.  But not so sure i like the team approach because I get confused about which team member i spoke to and can't help the puzzled look on my face when there are check ins on our table 2 minutes apart (my thought, didn't we just tell you we are okay, or didn't we just ask for more water . . .)  Overall, it's decent, and glad they are stepping up the service, but they probably need to work on some kind of organized system for the team check in/service.
Waited in entry areafor 15 minutes while there were lots of empty tables. Waited 30 minutes for one order of over cooked fajitas. Poor customer service.

Food is eh, typical Chili's. Service was expeditious and friendly (Bri? 5 Stars). Place is Fing filthy. Scum and fingerprints on kiosks and Bartenders POS and the cash drawer (thick scum on cash drawer) YUK. Bar top has crumbs and is sticky, chrome display for beer taps has filthy streaks as if wiped down with a dirty wet towel. Music is good screens are abundant. These managers are either deaf, dumb, or blind. This Chili's could be a gold mine (further than it already is) but the managers have no clue about managing a restaurant. I'll give them some advice: Sales, customer service, and CLEANLINESS!!!!!! Sales are good, customer service is good, CLEANLINESS IS A 2 out of 10. Who wants to eat at a filthy place when it only adds about $12/hr including labor burden...MANAGEMENT: your customers deserve better, pull your head out and get with a cleaning program!!!!!!

This is one of the most friendly and comfortable bars and restaurants in the area. The food is good, the service is fine and the bar is very nice.  It can get really busy at times so expect a wait and slower service at peak times.  The bartenders are fun and friendly.  Happy hour is very reasonable and their is a fun group of regulars.  Great place for the family or to stop for a cocktail.

The only reason I am giving this review one star is because the food was decent. Unfortunately, I cannot say anything good about the service at this particular restaurant. The server (Ernie) was either having a very bad night, or he was brand new at his job.  His service was extremely poor and very disappointing. He was drenched with sweat when he first introduced himself to us. After we got our food, it took him FOREVER to come back to our table to check on us before we were able to ask him for a side of ranch dressing. My wife ordered a second drink and the drink took so long that she did not get it until after she finished her meal.  When Ernie brought us the check, he placed it facedown on a small puddle of water, rendering the check soggy and hardly legible. To top it off, he forgot to return my credit card to me, which I did not realize until I left the restaurant. When I return to the restaurant to retrieve my credit card, Ernie had a bit of an attitude with me, even though it was his fault and not mine. Furthermore, Ernie said his manager (whom the hostess identified as "Mike") had the credit card, as Ernie walked to the kitchen to summon the manager to return my card. Moments later, Ernie came back with my card and handed it to me without saying a word of apology. I stood there expecting the manager to come and talk to me but he never showed up. I decided that it was a lost cause and left the establishment. If you're going to dine at a Chili's, go to a different one and not this one on Summit. Better yet, go to Applebee's on Sierra Lakes Parkway where the service is 10 times better.

When going to write this review I was very surprised at the star rating I actually had a great experience the other day at this restaurant some of the best customer service I found at restaurant since we moved to Fontana our server was named Janet she was amazing on top of everything never had to ask for extra drink also very impressed with another waitress by the name Jackie came to our table and said let me know if you guys need anything as well I've never had two waitresses do that at one table before very impressed I look forward to going back and getting the best service maybe you guys need to ask for Janet or Jackie the food was great lunch prices are affordable I think you get a good amount of food as well very impressed that you get a soup with the lunch special I recommend the carnitas fajitas they were delicious
I go to this location all the time service and food is always good.  It can get a little crowded on the weekend but it's better than the Rancho Cucamonga location

Came here to eat lunch with my parents and the service was atrocious. We cane in weren't even greeted about 5 minutes go by and they finally seat us. Our waitress came by to take our drink orders and we needed a few minutes but she didn't end up!coming back for 10 minutes. Like really.  The food is just awful. Just nothing special. Never will come here again.
We are regulars here. The service is great and they change the menu every couple months to keep it fresh. It helps that it's close to home.
As expected from a chain joint, except service was a little slow

We came just the beginning of dinner time. Even there were not house of full, but for party of 6 we still wait a little time for table. Friendly service! Multiple times came by to ask us if we need anything. Even they accidentally forgot my husband's order. The female manager came by and apologized for this. She had complimentary that order and still bags for us with no charge.  I have to say that Chill's service has been change this pass years. Getting better and better! Please keep the good work & we will back more!

We waited 45 mins to eat. It was on a Sunday night, not too packed. They never came by again to ask us if we wanted a refill or just to let us know how much longer our food was gonna take. Never coming here again. Service pretty much sucked.

I have had Chilis happy hour for years. I love the beer and the regular bone in wings. I have had the smoked wings and they are not the same. Now all they have on happy hour is the boneless wings which I am not fond of and the smoked bone in wings. I tried to like them tonight and I will not return to there happy hour. It is not the same now I have to pay for the chips and salsa and order wings that I do not like. I spend 50.00 a visit and I will have to change my happy hour spot.

Never had bad luck with the food here.  Have been making my way through the Southwest Pairings portion of the menu.  Last night had the green chile chicken enchilada and beef taco.  Not disappointed.  My wife had the grilled salmon and said it was cooked perfectly. It was busy last night but the server was very attentive, ensuring that we had everything we needed and that the food was exactly as we had ordered.  There have been a couple of occasions where a server was not as attentive as they could have been, but this was not one of them.

The quality went down a bit. Was disappointed. Soup came out sloppy. Rib eye steak was not as good as last visit. Dirty booth at the lounge Saturday night understandable. Lost one star from last review for lack of pride in presentation and lower standards in food quality.

I adore this place! My partner and I come here all the time because of how much we enjoy the food. We always get the 2 for $20 deal and that's always got great options. Their Cajun chicken pasta is amazing. That's my favorite thing on the menu. They have loaded mashed potatoes and those are also sooo good. Lemme tell you about their appetizers, they have Texas cheese fries and those always prepare you for a good meal because they too are so delicious!  As for lunch, they have a really good special, and their flatbread is yummy. The service there is average, never expect top notch because this place is affordable. But I enjoy this place more than I should, lol.
Great service In the bar area from Chilus!! He was such a great server. We were very pleased and we gave no complaints  he kept checking up on us and filling up our drinks. He deserved his 25% tip.

Service: slow as hell. For a party of two, 25 mins for appetizer to come out and 50 mins for food? GTFO. Also, our waitress had a stick up her butt; do your job and stop talking to your friends about your weekend.  Food: sub par...should have gone to Dennys.  Worst restaurant ever. Seriously, don't even waste your time here. I wish there was an option to give this place 0 stars. For starters, the waitress had a bad attitude from the moment she took our drink order...two iced waters. Then after she dropped off our appetizer, we didn't see her again for 45 mins. No popping in to check on us, nothing.  The water was the worst part. Nasty water. I get that it's tap water but it tasted like something died in it. It was revolting. When I mentioned this to our waitress, she just gave me a dirty look and asked if I wanted to order something else. So I got a soda....same thing. The water used to make the soda was the same nasty tasting crap. I didn't drink it after one sip.  The appetizer, spinach and artichoke dip, was okay but the chips tasted like someone dipped the bucket of chips in a salt bath. It made us thirsty but we couldn't drink the water! The food finally arrived almost 50 mins later....I had enough.  I spoke with the manager, Mike, about the issues. He acknowledged that they were having an issue with their water ALL DAY. Wtf. If you knew this, why expose your customers to it without compensating or offering bottled water?! For all I know, I could have been exposed to some nasty mold or God forbid E. coli in the water!  Seriously, do businesses not give a shit anymore?  Worst experience ever. The manager comped our dinner, but the damage was done. This place didn't squeeze a penny out of us, and for good reason.  Get your shit together, people. If I get food poisoning from the water, they will be hearing from my attorney in 2.5 seconds.  Ridiculous.

Our wait time was around 30 minutes and they sat a our group if 7 in a very small table for four five at best. It was ridiculous and embarrassing. We didnt even mind the wait since it was a friday night but to sit us in a table where we did not fit was not professional. We ordered our appetizers and when it was time to order our food we had to separate into two tables because our food didnt even fit. Im outting three stars because our server was really nice but not attentive. He would check in to see if we needed anything but then would not bring it. We asked for drinks and water with limons on the side. He never brought them and we asked three or four times. The food was very good and that is the only reason i would maybe come back but the customer service was not good at all.

Found a hair in my fajitas two weeks ago. It was on my shrimp. Gross. I don't want to come back for a very long time. This chilis isn't as good as the others. Will be sticking to Rancho or other Chilis.

Amazing service. My family and I went to Chilies tonight. Mind you there was 11 of us. We were sat within minutes. The waiter Alvro was beyond excellent with his service. Our appetizers came out hot and fast. We always had full drinks. Our order came out hot without any mistakes. That's always an issue with other places since we're always a large group.  The manager Mike came and check on us a few time to make sure everything was good, he also made sure our drinks were full. He talked with us and made us feel so comfortable. It was like we were at our family house. We will most definitely be coming back!!! Give this chilies a try!!!

Wanted to go out for HH before I had to go back to work tomorrow. Horrible service. SUPER slow.... to the point that I didn't even feel like ordering my entrée anymore. Hubs and kids ordered from the HH menu.. and food took FOREVER....Just ate some wings off my husband's HH plate. I ordered a second drink before HH ended but she never brought it... 20 minutes later she asked if I was ready for that 2nd drink... um.. No thank you. Kids wanted to order dessert but again... she just kept passing by us. Finally just stopped her mid-step to get our bill.

My "old timer" looks exactly like that. It looks a couple weeks old. Please don't ever go here. I got this hamburger for take out and $10 later this is what I get. Gross. Definitely not eating this because I don't want food poisoning tonight!

They treat you good here. Sometimes the service can be a little slow, but they do get busy rushes.  The servers are smiling and make you feel welcomed.  When I did have an issue with my appetizer taking longer than normal,  the manager Mike came to the table and rectified the situation.  His attitude and professional manner made me rate this place 5 stars.  The food is good for the value.  My favorite is the triple dipper

Came in here for a quick bite as soon as they opened and was greeted by everyone. Since I knew what I already wanted it took no time to place my order. I signed up for the email alerts so they emailed me a free chips and salsa coupon. Expecting them to be small I was shocked when the waitress brought out enough for 2 people to make it a meal. I also ordered buffalo wings and a cherry coke. I never once had to wait for a refill or ask for one, my waitress was on it. it's just too bad they are not closer to my house but I will be back here again.

Chilis is a nice place to relax after work especially on Wednesday nights at the bar. Excellent customer service and they always handle your order in time.  Foods is good and warm when served. Ask for Bree when you go there. Her customer service  skills are off the chain. The best.....

I've been here plenty of times but every time I go my steak is well done I order med rare and by the time my tables done eating I'm just getting my steak. They don't do anything for you although they do have good servers the food sucks.

So glad we went!  We sat in the bar area, it was pretty crowded and busy! Thought we would have to wait for everything.  Was so surprised in the service we received.  Our server Christian was awesome!   He was so attentive, and was on point the entire time.  We enjoyed beers, pretzels, and of course chips and salsa! Super yummy! Wasn't too excited with the cheese fries, But everything else was awesome! Especially our server Christian! :)

i love this restaurant, always come here for date night and family night!!! my fave drink here is el president margarita soooo bombie!!!! and husband loves the bloody marys!!! crew is always so helpful and attentive!!!! wait is never long and I just love the atmosphere in general always and forever will be a customer!!!!!!

Have been here a handful of times before yelp existed and have always had great service. This Father's Day was a bit different. Our server got there quick after being seated, but it took a little longer than usual to get our drinks and our appetizers. I get the tablets on the tables making it a bit easier to order extras and pay your bill, but it seems to take away from customer service. It seems as if the servers depend on them more than they have to and makes them try a little less and they seem to come around the tables less. We asked our server if we could take it off the table so our little ones wouldn't break it, but we were told that we pay and order extras from there. Our server never came back to ask us for dessert or give us our check. We had to figure it out ourselves after waiting a while. We'll go back now that we know but they need to let people know about what the kiosk tablets are for. Not the best Father's Day meal I have had.

Made a big mistake by not yelping ahead of time. This place used to be good. We ordered cheeseburgers and they forgot to add the cheese to our burgers. We sent it back and they just slapped it on cold. Really? Is this how you feel about your customers who keep you employed? I give 1 star to the servers. Friendly and attentive. Never. Going. Back.
This Chilies is just so so. We don't really choose to eat here and every time we do it isn't really that great.   Never really had any problems

Had not been here in awhile. Now I remember why. One person working the bar and there are 3 dirty tables. Food was good but service was extremely slow due to understaffing. It lunch time and I'd expect better.

We eat at Chili's all the time. Haven't been in awhile. Decided to come tonight. Sat in the booths at the bar. Knew going in service would be slow, but tonight was crazy. Server took our order. I ordered chicken fajitas. My husband and daughters food came out. Not delivered by our sever. But mine never came. Our server never came to check on is so I could tell her my food wasn't brought out. I had to track someone down. Finally told server my food wasn't delivered. By the time my food was delivered my family was done. The manager never came out to check on us. Not once. Comped my food but never came to apologize. Nothing. We didn't want free food...we wanted a manager and server who actually gave a damn. So pathetic. I told our server how disappointed we were. She saw me filling out the complaint thing on the computer. Her comment "I'm sure that's gonna be bad". Just crappy all around. We will not be back. We have not been to that Chili's again. The one up the hill in Victorville has amazing service and manger came to check on us. Just to see how we were. Too bad they aren't all the same.

I came here with my preschool aged daughters! They sat us in a designated area where it was decorated like a pirate adventure! They had cartoons on and this cool tabletop gadget that had the menu and you can order appetizers And pay your bill with! The place was clean and decent! The food...not so good! I ordered the chipotle chicken bowl because i thought it would be spicy but had to add cholula! It lacked lots of flavor!

Came here and our food got lost but honestly it was Mother's Day and the place was packed so me and my family were just relaxing waiting for our food . The manager payed for our food because it took so long . These people care about their customers and that is the most important thing. Will defiantly come back any time. Thank you for making my Moms day special .
This Chili's should change there name to Slowi's...4 tables 2 severs 20 minutes just to order, stop talking about UR weekend and do ur job.

I don't usually go to chain restaurants, but it was the best thing to eat, after a cold and wet soccer game with my son and his friends. The food was good, and service the same. With these restaurants, it's hit or miss. Today was a hit.

We go to Chili's in Fontana when we are looking for fine dining and our options are down to this joint or yet another Mickey D's or Panda Express. There were more servers than customers and yet the service was still mediocre.  Nice. Our server had a lower jaw ring (or super low lip ring, pretty much stuck through his jowls) that looked to be a replica of Seattle's Space Needle.  It was so big I thought it was actually intended to be a junior Space Needle.  Memo to Chili's:  Overly obvious and grotesque piercings on your "front of the house" staff should probably be discouraged. The restroom was a horror show.  Maybe one of those 50 employees goofing off in front could grab a mop and check the condition of the can once every dozen hours or so. My burger was overcooked but serviceable.  I mean, it's Chili's.   3 stars is generous but whatever.  It's Chili's.

I have seen a lot of reviews about this location with the same complaint... SLOW SLOW SLOW!!   We waited almost 40 minutes to get our food!!  We checked in on Foursquare, so I know exactly when we ordered.  We also got free chips and salsa, and that took forever to get to the table.    We had a wedding to attend, and by the time the food came, we asked for the check and boxes!!  THAT'S NOT THE WAY we wanted to eat lunch!!   When I told the server (EMILY) that the food service was slow and we had to go... she just looked at me... NEVER a word of apology!   I spoke with the manager on the way out the door... he just smiled like he had heard it all before, but could give a RIP!  He did apologize for the food being slow.  The server was standing there also, and I told the manager that I didn't believe it was the server's fault, but the KITCHEN's fault... again, the server just looked... without even a word of apology!   We spent $60 for the four of us, and what we couldn't BOX... we left on the table! POOR POOR POOR SERVICE!!  Do NOT eat at this location unless you have plenty of time on your hands...

This review is for their happy hour. I enjoyed their happy hour, the appetizers we got were good & the chocolate paradise pie was AWESOME. our servers were pretty good, one of them took a little longer than the other. This visit was better than the last one.

Alright, I concur with the majority of the other reviewers here, but I rarely give a One Star rating. This establishment should, perhaps, be rated with the lowest possible marks, but I'll give the waitress credit for the additional Star. I will say their Ribeye Steak is better than what you could normally find in the UK. But, that's really not saying much. The Brits do two things marginally well: Fish and Chips. Steaks in the UK are overcooked, cow biscuits. I was a bit surprised at how leathery and gristly their Ribeye was here. I was almost nostalgic and homesick. I thought I'd never find a steak quite as bad as the ones I get back home. Though I ordered it medium rare, and because it was so thin, it was essentially well-done. Hideous. It was the colour of dried dung with grill marks scored into it. And they didn't have any Bombay Sapphire gin for a proper martini.  Again, I remind the good reader that I am well aware of where I was. This was Chili's. I knew it wasn't Morton's or Ruth's Chris or Flemings. My expectations were already low. Thank you, Chili's of Fontucky, for reminding me that even when you think things can't get any worse, they actually CAN.

we came in the other night because I received a gift certificate for Christmas.  we were seated immediately and our waitress Deanna was right there with a quick smile and lots of patience.. our chips and salsa were to die for..  my boyfriend had the chicken fajitas.. he really enjoyed them a lot.. I had a chicken bacon thing.. never have I tasted chicken so tender.. Deanna was always right there to refill drinks and salsa.. she is a hidden gem that I hope the management are aware they have.. she told us she has a little one at home. as a mom I know how hard it can be to have a baby and still work.. I was impressed with her ability to be genuinely friendly and knowledgeable
It's not the fanciest place in the world, but the food is good and it's noisy enough to take the kids.

This Chili's is disappointing compared to others Chili's I've been to in different areas of the country. The servers are sub-par as well as the food. The only reason it has a crowd is because it is the only restaurant of that type in that immediate area so the choices are limited. Last time we were there my wife order a steak - medium and it came out bloody. The manager came out and was awkwardly nonchalant about it. He said several times that the steak was very rare.  They took it off the bill and gave us one to go. When we got home and opened the box it was a different steak but just as bloody. Raw / Cold food, poor service, bad cooks. We will not go here again.

We waited 50 minutes for nasty cold food. The food was missing items "avocado" soup never came and everything was gross. The whole family ended up with a food born illness that gave us runs. Keep away! It's disgusting, I'm still sick! The manager apologized and offered to give us a free desert? What a joke! The manager also agreed that they have bad cooks that make allot of mistakes... I was confused? Why don't you FIRE them and get good cooks if you know they suck!

I would not recommend this location. The service was average, but I didn't like the fact that we had like three different servers. I noticed my buffalo wings were a bit cold but didn't think too much of it until I took a bite. My wings were completely raw on the inside! Talk about salmonella! We brought it to our waitresses attention, and they brought out a fresh batch of wings, which took far too long I might add. The manager visited our table to apologize, but he was very socially awkward, insincere and downright creepy! I will not be dining here again; heed warning.

8.4.10: Chilis: I haven't ate at chilis in over 7 years or so. It's not that I don't like it, it just never happened. I bumped into my friend at the gym, so after our workout we decided to eat dinner and catch up. I ordered the healthy chicken plate with black beans and brown rice. I didn't realized that I was that hungry to the point I finished my entire dish. There was no leftovers this time and it wasn't a small meal either. I really enjoy the my chicken, it wasn't dry and it had lots of flavor to my surprise. So I enjoy eating here, yay another place I can rely on to eat in Fontana, however on that note, the wait was super duper long to get any service..

They only gave me 32 fries with my chicken sandwich.  If you are going to skimp on fries, at least use a garnish to hide the bottom of the plate when you bring out the food.  Chicken fajitas were dry.

All I can say is terrible service!! Waited FOREVER to get our food and to top it off the server added items to our recipe that we never ordered! It took server 3 times to get it right!! Oh let's not forget he added his own tip on recipe!! I will never step a foot there again!!
Service could of been better. But the chicken crispers is still the bomb
Love going there for happy hour and stevie always takes care of me when. great place especially in the bar area

My experience started out ALL BAD! I ordered a side salad and large nachos with no meat for my son and I to share. I was already in a bit of a bad mood because my drink was so packed with ice I could barely get my straw in (grapefruit juice). I hate that! Anyhow, come to find out my supposed to be meatless nachos had meat in them. I specifically told the girl like 5 times no meat. There's nothing I could have done to make it clearer. I gotta be honest, I was PISSED! She might as well have just spat in my food right there at the table. I wanted to just leave, but being 35 weeks pregnant and starving that wasn't really an option. The manager made it right though. Even though I feel bad about getting free food. That's the only train I hate complaining, I don't want them to think I'm just trying to get a free meal/discount. Feel me? The manager (Kyle) made me feel a lot better though, so I'm happy now. We'll be back to give em another try in the future. Hopefully I won't have to edit my review in a bad way ;)

Was muey bueno!  My husband and I had the 2 for $20 deal and both came away stuffed.  The ribs were yummy and the veggies were delicious! Our waitress was very friendly and attentive, although I must say it was fairly early and not especially busy during our visit. We had no wait at all, the hostess took us right in to be seated.

Live locally have tried to give the place several chances because there are no other bars nearby. Service at bar is horribly slow, bartender seems to be more interested in coworkers and bs-ing with friends.

Went here on Veterans Day, horrible service. Beers came fast, and were a dollar off (thanks happy hour). Came as a party of 6, no table settings and chips and salsa took a while but were endless. Entrees came before appetizer. Server forgot to write my order even though I looked him in the eye and told him. Manager came out with the appetizers and brought table settings and offered to take them off the bill. As a Veteran, I regret not eating for free at Applebees even though I ended up eating for free here.
I always enjoy coming here to eat. The food is delicious and they give pretty big portions. Service is always friendly and accommodating. I do miss the Awesome Blossoms though.. it's been a while :(

Horrible slow service! Always have ordered the same lunch special, soup and salad and the wait is ridiculously LONG! Soup even came out cold one time! Don't go during lunch if you are need to be somewhere following lunch!
Great food always, sometimes slow service for a medium size group. They are always friendly though...

I will only be returning here to have drinks since I am a fan of their El presidente margarita. Had lunch here the other day with my mom and son and the food was terrible. I ordered a cup of the chicken and green chili soup which came out lukewarm (plus had to be returned once because they forgot to add the chicken, wtf?), the rice tasted like it was from the night before all old and stale, and the soup was so salty I couldn't finish it. My moms corn soup actually had a good taste but also came out lukewarm. The Cobb salad was OK, not much flavor to it, could have made a better salad at home for cheaper. My son was happy with his fries and burger but as long as he has fries he is a happy camper.

What do you think of when you go to Chili's?  You know, that song.  "I want my baby back baby back baby back ribs".  That's the song I was singing when I entered Chili's.  The hostess looked at me funny and did not know whether to escort me to my seat or to escort me out.  I decided to ditch her and walk over to the bar area and seat myself along with my wife. Needless to say, I ordered the ribs; I should have really ordered the full rack of one of the ribs and not 2 halves because I felt gipped.  The 2 halves I ordered were the Chili's original and the honey-chipotle ribs.  I expected the original Chili to be good, but the honey-chipotle was waaaaaay better.  However, my gripe was that the half-racks are tiny!  I finished them with room to spare.  What the heck?!  I'm still hungry.  The only thing I could do was finish off my beer and go home sad.  Oh yeah, the service was super slow.
my family and I love this place !!! down the street from my house, we get in and out with great service and good food!!
The food and service was good. My only problem was they sat me by the kitchen where they were yelling and banging shit making way to much noise. NEVER MAKE PEOPLE SIT BY THE KITCHEN!!

This has got to be the worst Chilis on the face of the planet!  The service is lousey and the staff seem like its a chore to serve you.  Not one of our orders was right and it took forever to get appetizers.  They blamed it on a lack of skillets.  Hello it's a resturant...how can you not have enough skillets.  Thats why you hire minimum wage workers to clean the dirty ones!  The last 2 times we were there, at least one of our meals ended up on the floor.  The last time I had to get up and refill my own drink!  We wont be going back to this Chilis again.  The Chilis in Glendora is awesome, though, and J.P. will treat you like a king AND get  your order right!  Do yourself a favor and skip this Chilis!

Wow this place is terrible!!! SLOW SLOW SLOW and awful service!!! Took forever to get our food and they weren't even good!!! I ordered the Tilapia with rice and it was nasty, the rice was hard and burnt and the fish was gross!!! My kids got the baby back ribs and they didn't liked them either, too salty and over cooked!!! Even my little one's Mac n Cheese was dry and tasteless!!! My husband had the sirloin steak and it was nothing special. He asked for some steak sauce and the server never came back for it so we had to ask the greeter at the door to bring us the steak sauce!!! We didn't even want to eat our food anymore, we just wanted to leave the restaurant so badly that we just asked for to-go boxes!!! Even getting our check and paying for it took longer that it should!!! My kids and I just left an waited in the car for my husband to pay the bill!!! I've read some of the reviews about this place and it seem like most complaints are about very slow and poor service!!! You would think management would've taken these complaints to heart and make some improvements!

Ok, i am officially done with this Chili's. Its great that they are always doing fundraisers with the fire dept. but I am done. We came here about 8pm on Sunday night and it was packed. They said about 20min wait. So we are waiting for atleast 20 mins and we see the tables open up just right of the door around the wall. We had 6 of us. The tables opened up for us to be seated and they give the table to a smaller group that came in 5mins after us. My mom flips out and they say there sorry over and over and that they didnt realize that those 2 tables where right next to each other and that you only had to push them together. So we leave. So a few days later we are looking for a quick bite and my son calls my mom and says how about Chilis, joking around. She says fine if you want to go. horrible again. We got sat right away but they screwed up the order and took forever on the refills. My ribs where dry and nasty. It is just a horrible expereince over and over. I am never going back here.
I ate at Chili's for the first time today and loved the $20 for 2 and free entree. The food was great, the service was great. Generous portions.
My husband and I love Chili's they always have great deals not to mention the yummy food :]

i smell like oil that has been sitting for months. my morningstar black bean patty was overcooked and hard i almost shat my pants before i even left the restaurant. probably because my digestive system isnt used to eating disgustly horrible unhealthy multi-national chain poison
overcooked black bean patty, still-cold, fresh off the refrigerator burger, and very tiny servings of quesadilla.. good job once again chili's, i guess wherever you go, it's all the same deal..

I went here with a family group a couple months ago.  Appetizers took a long time to shop up.  I ordered a plate of half ribs with spicy dry rub, and something else, not memorable enough to remember, but at least not that bad.  The ribs had little meat, and were dried out.  The cole slaw was warm; it was obvious my plate had spent some time under heat lamps.  I presume the only reason this place is still in business is that there is a lot of fairly new housing in the area, and people haven't found the good local restaurants.
